alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN WHEELER COUNTY THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 901 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Bartlett, or 22 miles west of Neligh, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Wheeler County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
